newsitem.title: USA: USDA's Glickman - CRP delay not an option.
newsitem.headline: USDA's Glickman - CRP delay not an option.

text.p: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Dan Glickman Friday said delaying the start of the revamped Conservation Reserve Program was not an option.

"There's a lot of nail-biting going on about the new CRP. There's even speculation that we're going to put this off for a year," Glickman told a gathering of U.S. corn and soybean growers via in a televised address.
"I want to tell you that's not an option in my book and I am not given the power to do that anyway under congressional law," he said.
Signup for the land-idling program starts Monday. Some lawmakers and farm groups have said there is too little time to make the new rule work.

Glickman said the USDA staff was "100 percent convinced" they could get the proram underway and pointed out that last year USDA enrolled 1.7 million producers in market transition payments in under three months.
